trans-unit.source: title: Supported Windows Guest Operating Systems
trans-unit.target: title: Supported Windows Guest Operating Systems

trans-unit.source: This article lists the Windows operating systems supported as guests in Hyper-V on Windows, as well provides information about integration services.
trans-unit.target: This article lists the Windows operating systems supported as guests in Hyper-V on Windows, as well provides information about integration services.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 runs as a guest operating system on Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 runs as a guest operating system on Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts.

trans-unit.source: Support means Microsoft has tested these host/guest combinations.
trans-unit.target: Support means Microsoft has tested these host/guest combinations.

trans-unit.source: Issues with these combinations may receive attention from Product Support Services.
trans-unit.target: Issues with these combinations may receive attention from Product Support Services.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft provides support for guest operating systems in the following manner:
trans-unit.target: Microsoft provides support for guest operating systems in the following manner:

trans-unit.source: Issues found in Microsoft operating systems and in integration services are supported by Microsoft support.
trans-unit.target: Issues found in Microsoft operating systems and in integration services are supported by Microsoft support.

trans-unit.source: For issues found in other operating systems that have been certified by the operating system vendor to run on Hyper-V, support is provided by the vendor.
trans-unit.target: For issues found in other operating systems that have been certified by the operating system vendor to run on Hyper-V, support is provided by the vendor.

trans-unit.source: For issues found in other operating systems, Microsoft submits the issue to the multi-vendor support community, [TSANet](http://www.tsanet.org/).
trans-unit.target: For issues found in other operating systems, Microsoft submits the issue to the multi-vendor support community, [TSANet](http://www.tsanet.org/).

trans-unit.source: What are integration services and why do they matter?
trans-unit.target: What are integration services and why do they matter?

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V includes integration services for supported guest operating systems.
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V includes integration services for supported guest operating systems.

trans-unit.source: Integration services improve interaction between the host system and the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Integration services improve interaction between the host system and the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Some operating systems (including different versions of Windows) have the integration services built-in, while others provide integration services through Windows Update.
trans-unit.target: Some operating systems (including different versions of Windows) have the integration services built-in, while others provide integration services through Windows Update.

trans-unit.source: Supported Windows Server guest operating systems
trans-unit.target: Supported Windows Server guest operating systems

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP 1)
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP 1)

trans-unit.source: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Datacenter, Enterprise, Standard and Web editions.
trans-unit.target: Datacenter, Enterprise, Standard and Web editions.

trans-unit.source: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Datacenter, Enterprise, Standard and Web editions (32-bit and 64-bit).
trans-unit.target: Datacenter, Enterprise, Standard and Web editions (32-bit and 64-bit).

trans-unit.source: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Ultimate, Enterprise, and Professional editions (32-bit and 64-bit).
trans-unit.target: Ultimate, Enterprise, and Professional editions (32-bit and 64-bit).

trans-unit.source: Upgrade the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Ultimate, Enterprise, and Professional editions (32-bit and 64-bit).
trans-unit.target: Ultimate, Enterprise, and Professional editions (32-bit and 64-bit).

trans-unit.source: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Install the integration services after you set up the operating system in the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Business, Enterprise, and Ultimate, including N and KN editions.
trans-unit.target: Business, Enterprise, and Ultimate, including N and KN editions.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 is a guest operating system on Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 is a guest operating system on Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts.

trans-unit.source: There are caveats around specific kernel versions.
trans-unit.target: There are caveats around specific kernel versions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, including support information on past versions of Hyper-V, see [Linux and FreeBSD Virtual Machines on Hyper-V](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn531030.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, including support information on past versions of Hyper-V, see [Linux and FreeBSD Virtual Machines on Hyper-V](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/dn531030.aspx).
